perturbation.original_text: Reseller's customers (the "Customers") are defined as those organizations/enterprises that will market and manage the end-users of the Products (the "End-Users"). Reseller acknowledges and agrees that it does not have the right to assign sub-resellers under this Agreement  outside of the Territory, except with the prior written consent of Diversinet.
perturbation.changed_text: Reseller's customers (the "Customers") are defined as those organizations/enterprises who are in active discussions with Reseller, regardless of whether they have committed to purchasing the Products (the "End-Users"). Reseller acknowledges and agrees that it does have the right to assign sub-resellers under this Agreement  outside of the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Customers' is changed from those who 'will market and manage' the end-users to those 'in active discussions', broadening the scope. The statement about assigning sub-resellers is contradicted by removing the need for Diversinet's consent.

perturbation.original_text: Diversinet will arrange for the initial personal technical and sales instruction of up to three (3) Reseller personnel for up to five (5) days in  learning the functions, installation, integration, operation and maintenance of the Products. Such instruction shall take place in Diversinet's  corporate headquarters and expenses of the Reseller personnel incurred for attending such initial instruction shall be paid by Reseller. There will be no charge for this initial training.
perturbation.changed_text: Diversinet will arrange for the initial personal technical and sales instruction of up to three (3) Reseller personnel for up to five (5) days in  learning the functions, installation, integration, operation and maintenance of the Products. Such instruction shall take place in Diversinet's  corporate headquarters, or remotely via digital means. Expenses of the Reseller personnel incurred for attending such initial instruction shall be split equally between the parties. There will be a standard $1,000 per day charge for this initial training.
perturbation.explanation: The change modifies details of the training, including location flexibility, shared expenses, and the introduction of a daily training charge, contradicting the original clause of 'no charge'.

These changed conditions directly contradict the original, completely altering the rights and restrictions of the Customer concerning product use and ownership. This would create significant legal ambiguity.
